channel.title: Forum suggestion : solved topics?
channel.description:
Hey :)
I would like to suggest that a topic "solved" function should be implemented into the community. That would make it easier for everyone to find answers to their issues. The overall thread could have "solved" mark so when searching you can see which ones have been solved. And maybe also the post that solves the topic should have it too.
For example yesterday I posted a question about embedded objects and it was pretty quickly solved. It could be tagged as solved to make it easier for users to find "definitive" answers.
What do the main developers think?
@johannes @thetechnobear
Thanks
Link to example thread with embedded object question: https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/how-to-turn-an-embedded-object-patch-object-into-real-object/2179/7

item.title: Forum suggestion : solved topics?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

(renamed topic to make less generic)

I like the idea...

there is an official 'solved' plugin for discourse

meta.discourse.org

Discourse Solved (Accepted answer plugin)

About The Discourse Solved plugin allows users to accept solutions on topics in designated categories. Requirements Discourse version v1.4.0.beta2 +65 or later Installation Repo is at: https://github.com/discourse/discourse-solved In your app.yml add: hooks: after_code: - exec: cd: $home/plugins cmd: - mkdir -p plugins - git clone https://github.com/discourse/docker_manager.git - git clone https://github.com/discourse/discourse-sol...

Reading time: 15 mins üïë Likes: 204 ‚ù§

the advantage of this over tags, is users can mark the post which solves the topic, and then the original post has a link to the 'solution post'

(it can be configured to allow 'solved' in one certain categories, which may be useful.. say in the helpdesk area?)

@johannes what do think? (it needs server access to install, so up to you )

just one note...
this will be as successful as community members make it as they need to mark solutions.
also, its only really going to work for topics that are one issue...so topic which fire different questions wont work so well.
(and perhaps obvious, but we moderate with a 'light touch' here, so won't be routinely marking things solved)
